main.name: Henry Ebomah
main.description: I love meeting people and collaborating to solve problems using software
main.bio: Hi there! I have been involved in several web projects and spearheaded a few, working with diverse teams of UI/UX designers, web developers, digital marketers and app developers. We used asynchronous tools like trello, jira, confluence and user interview surveys.
main.contactmessage: Get in touch with me if you are looking for a passionate problem solver!

education.description: Client-side developer| Server-side programmer| Advanced Frontend developer

work.title: Tech/Project Lead
work.description: Developed a mobile app that helps people request an ambulance by the push of a button| We used Figma, JavaScript and Flutter with a team of designers and developers| Hosted the database of the client side on firebase servers.

projects.title: HobbyDutch
projects.category: An online app that let talents engage in live events. Working with two other developers, the goal was to help reduce depression and loneliness. Teckstack used was Flutter/android

projects.title: Remote Work
projects.category: A platform that lets you know about a company using videos before applying to jobs. I worked with user interviews/surveys when I noticed the exponential growth of remote work in 2020, which inspired this website.Teck stack -jQuery, JavaScript/Web Apps

projects.title: Avengers Coding Quiz
projects.category: Coding quiz to attract fans of Marvel Comics who want to study JavaScript. Programming can be difficult if you are new to it, so this makes it fun. Tech stack - React

projects.title: Git Links to Projects
projects.category: The projects listed here and more projects can be found here.

testimonials.text: Joining a part-time coding boot camp has been among the best decisions I've made in my life. However with Henry's handholding support during code challenges, I learnt more in one month than I did in 6 months of teaching myself how to program.

Henry was quick, courteous and very helpful. He helped me build my web app completely after solving the UI issue. I was worried it wouldnâ€™t be done in time for my web launch party, but he finished the job with time to spare!
